title: The 10 Best Natural Energy Drinks
author: Medical Author Nazneen Memon; BHMS; PGDCR Medical Reviewer Pallavi Suyog Uttekar; MD
description: Most energy drinks are full of added sugar, artificial ingredients, and high amounts of caffeine. Here are 10 natural and healthy energy drinks that can help you stay fueled without the side effects.
cleaned_text: Energy [drinks](https://www.medicinenet.com/drinks_and_beverages_quiz/quiz.htm) aim to boost performance and give you a pick-me-up that can help you get through the day. But most are full of added [sugar](https://www.medicinenet.com/sugar_addiction_pictures_slideshow/article.htm), artificial ingredients, and high amounts of [caffeine](https://www.medicinenet.com/caffeine/article.htm). Here are 10 natural and healthy energy drinks that can help you stay fueled without the side effects. 10 of the best natural energy drinks 1. ZOA+ pre-workout energy drink This pre-workout energy drink is brimming with [vitamin C](https://www.medicinenet.com/ascorbic_acid-oral/article.htm) for immune support, B [vitamins](https://www.medicinenet.com/vitamins_and_calcium_supplements/article.htm) for mental focus, [electrolytes](https://www.medicinenet.com/electrolytes/article.htm) to keep you hydrated, and 200 mg of [caffeine](https://www.medicinenet.com/caffeine_quiz/quiz.htm) from [green tea](https://www.medicinenet.com/green_tea_camellia_sinensis-oral/article.htm) and unroasted coffee beans. It also has only 15 calories with no added [sugar](https://www.medicinenet.com/sugar_quiz/quiz.htm). 2. Celsius Celsius is a vegan and kosher energy drink that provides functional energy from green tea extract and [guarana](https://www.medicinenet.com/guarana_paullinia_cupana-oral/article.htm) seed extract, plus additional metabolism-boosting ingredients such as chromium and B [vitamins](https://www.medicinenet.com/vitamins_and_supplements_quiz/quiz.htm) 3. Riff energy + immunity Riff's certified carbon neutral and plant-powered energy drink contains the daily recommended dose of vitamin C and 120 mg of caffeine. Made from natural cane sugar and real fruit juices, it is free of GMOs and artificial ingredients 4. MatchaBar hustle energy This mango-flavored energy drink contains fruit juice, ceremonial grade matcha, and green tea extract. It contains about 40 calories and 120 mg of caffeine 5. Guayaki yerba mate Guayaki yerba mate is a lemon-flavored, noncarbonated blend of brewed yerba mate and organic fruit juice. It contains about 100 calories and 150 mg of caffeine. 6. Proper Wild Clean All Day Energy shots This [ginger](https://www.medicinenet.com/ginger_zingiber_officinale-oral/article.htm)-flavored product has antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties that can help reduce [stress](https://www.medicinenet.com/stress/article.htm) and boost brain function. It contains about 35 calories and 180 mg of caffeine 7. Toro matcha sparkling ginger Packed with organic lemon and ginger juices and organic Japanese matcha, this energy drink has about 10 calories and 600 mg of caffeine. 8. Mati unsweetened sparkling organic energy drink This is made with brewed guayusa tea, which comes from the leaves of an evergreen tree that grows in the Amazon. Contains almost no calories and 115 mg of caffeine. 9. Rockstar organic energy drink Rockstar delivers a natural energy boost fueled by organic ingredients. It is free of preservatives, artificial flavors, and colors. 10. Ora renewable energy This is a vegan and organic drink that contains performance-enhancing ingredients without any sugars or artificial colors and preservatives. It contains about 135 calories and 90 mg of caffeine. What are the pros and cons of energy drinks? Energy drinks are used by many people to: - Boost energy - Enhance athletic performance - Promote recovery after [exercise](https://www.medicinenet.com/exercise/article.htm) - Improve concentration - Improve memory - Elevate mood However, most energy drinks that are high in sugar and caffeine have downsides such as the following: - Energy is usually short-lived and may be followed by a sugar crash - Large amounts of caffeine can cause [anxiety](https://www.medicinenet.com/anxiety/article.htm), [headaches](https://www.medicinenet.com/headache/article.htm), [dehydration](https://www.medicinenet.com/dehydration/article.htm), [heart](https://www.medicinenet.com/heart_how_the_heart_works/article.htm)problems, and digestive problems - May cause [weight gain](https://www.medicinenet.com/weight_gain/symptoms.htm)due to the high sugar content - May cause an increased risk of dental erosion [](https://www.medicinenet.com/superfoods_quiz/quiz.htm) QUESTIONSee Answer 8 Best Energy Drinks of 2022, According to Registered Dietitians. But some of the things you eat may backfire and crash your energy before long. Find out which ones might do that. Foods to Boost Your Energy and MoodLearn which foods may boost your energy level and have a positive impact on your mood. Foods such as salmon, Brazil nuts, and dark chocolate can give you more energy and make you happier. guaranaGuarana seeds, dried and powdered, are used as a dietary supplement for weight loss, to enhance athletic performance, as a stimulant similar to coffee, and for many other purposes. Guarana is available over the counter (OTC) as a powder, tablet, or capsule. Common side effects of guarana include headache, agitation, anxiety, irritability, restlessness, nervousness, insomnia, delirium, dizziness, ringing in the ears (tinnitus), muscle spasms, convulsions, increased respiration, irregular heart rhythms (arrhythmias), rapid heart rate (tachycardia), high blood pressure (hypertension), high blood glucose levels (hyperglycemia), and others. Do not take if pregnant or breastfeeding. How Can I Get My Energy Back?Ways to get your energy back include a good diet, getting exercise, and working on your mental health. How Can I Increase My Body Energy Instantly?Utilizing these 13 energy-boosting hacks can help you feel refreshed and gain energy instantly. Sugar QuizSugar lurks in surprising places. Take the Sugar Quiz to learn of the many ways sugar sneaks into your diet and see what you know about sugar and artificial sweeteners! What Are the 11 Best Energy Boosters?Do you know what the 11 best foods are for an energy boost? What to know about various ways to boost your energy through diet and feel more rested. What Is the Best Energy Booster?Markets are flooded with products and supplements that claim to boost your energy levels, but there's little evidence that they work. A healthy lifestyle with adequate sleep, regular exercise and nutritious diet is what one needs to stay active and energized. Why Are Energy Shots Bad for You?Energy shots can be bad for you because they contain extreme amounts of caffeine, are bad for your health, and could cause safety hazards.
